result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Aleiha Marie Dorn not in court, in custody.

Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Final pretrial.
Defendant appearance waived due to her is in custody status at a Juvenile detention center.

Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Received and Filed: Request to adjourn 11-14-2022 trial date.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Aleiha Marie Dorn.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Status Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a resolution date. 
State advises the court this is a Co-Defendant case and 
Counsel has not been appointed, cases has not been severed  and  a preliminary hearing is needed.
Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
\ Defendant to have no contact with: JD, KD and Co-actor KM.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Aleiha Marie Dorn in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Aleiha Marie Dorn in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court on defense motion to modify bail/ conditions of bond. Statment made by defense counsel regarding juvenile case. Statement made by the State. 
 Court GRANTED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the recordDefense request a status date to review discovery material with defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjournedCase remains calendared in Branch 19. Status Conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Aleiha Marie Dorn not in court, in custody.  Alexandria Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Bailbond Hearing to modify cash bond.   State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Arguments heard.  Court ordered matter adjourned for defense to obtain information from defendant Juvenile Case.
Defense in receipt of discovery. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Aleiha Marie Dorn in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Aleiha Marie Dorn in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  However, Defense filed a request for substitution of Judge.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Ashley, Br. 19.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 19, Rm 313 SB.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed and forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Aleiha Marie Dorn in court with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Aleiha Marie Dorn in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Slomczewski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Defense filed a request for substitution of Judge - there is a co-defendant in this matter so the request is not honored at this time. 
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 Safety Bldg.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Aleiha Marie Dorn in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Aleiha Marie Dorn in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aleiha Marie Dorn appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
